intro: Traganthes pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed traganthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features slender, linear leaves arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in whorls, with vibrant colors ranging from pink to red. Traganthes pinnatifida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and prolonged blooming period.
